unnormalised: **Bollywood Releases: Will Your Biceps Survive the Ticket Rush?**
normalised: Bollywood Releases: Will Your Biceps Survive the Ticket Rush?

unnormalised: Mumbai – Bollywood is about to explode! This Friday, 23/06/2024, brace yourselves for a triple dose of drama, comedy, and questionable dance moves. First up, "Prem's Promise," a romantic saga promising enough tears to fill the Arabian Sea. Early reviews suggest watching it at 14:00 hrs with a box of tissues.
normalised: Mumbai – Bollywood is about to explode! This Friday, twenty third June two thousand and twenty four, brace yourselves for a triple dose of drama, comedy, and questionable dance moves. First up, "Prem's Promise," a romantic saga promising enough tears to fill the Arabian Sea. Early reviews suggest watching it at two post meridiem with a box of tissues.

unnormalised: Then there’s “Dhoom Dhaam Dhakka,” an action-comedy featuring Sanjay Dutt wielding a lathi…again. Trade analysts predict it'll cross Rs. 100 crore in the first week, mostly from sheer nostalgia. They say if you arrive after 09:00 AM, you’ll be 2 km away from the theatre.
normalised: Then there’s “Dhoom Dhaam Dhakka,” an action-comedy featuring Sanjay Dutt wielding a lathi…again. Trade analysts predict it'll cross rupee one hundred crore in the first week, mostly from sheer nostalgia. They say if you arrive after nine ante meridiem, you’ll be two kilometer away from the theatre.

unnormalised: Finally, "Sharmaji Ka Smartphone," a quirky family drama exploring the perils of… well, Sharmaji and his smartphone. It’s been lauded by critics as “surprisingly watchable,” which, in Bollywood, is high praise indeed. Releasing also this coming Eid, 17/06/2024. Better book your tickets now, or face the wrath of the Bollywood booking gods! May your auto-rickshaw rides to the cinema be swift and your samosas be hot!
normalised: Finally, "Sharmaji Ka Smartphone," a quirky family drama exploring the perils of… well, Sharmaji and his smartphone. It’s been lauded by critics as “surprisingly watchable,” which, in Bollywood, is high praise indeed. Releasing also this coming Eid, seventeenth June two thousand and twenty four. Better book your tickets now, or face the wrath of the Bollywood booking gods! May your auto-rickshaw rides to the cinema be swift and your samosas be hot!
